body.p: The Commonwealth of Kentucky to any peace officer of Mercer County

It appearing that there are reasonable grounds for believing that John D Hale has been guilty of a breach of the peace by drawing a pistol on Jefferson Roberds on the streets of Harrodsburg on the 6th day of September 1865. You are commanded forthwith to arrest the said John D Hale and bring him before me to be dealt with according to law, Given under my hand this 6th day of September 1865
Thomas H. Hardin P. J. T H
Summons as witnesses for the Commonwealth Charles A. Hardin and Thomas C. Bell

T, H, Hardin P. J. T. H
